domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text: @AaronBell4NUL @vuecinemas @EnvAgency I for one will be choosing NOT to spend any more money or time in Newcastle than I absolutely have to.Many people will be having the same thoughts. That’s a lot of revenue that’s been lost, especially as businesses try to build back from the pandemic👇 @SimonTagg #stopthestink https://t.co/LhpKdOiOBO

@AaronBell4NUL @vuecinemas @EnvAgency And they just keep coming tonight, endless stream of complaints in town. If you don’t listen to us residents, you’d best believe you’ll be listening to the sound of money leaving the town centre! 💰@SimonTagg #stopthestink https://t.co/vMmX75rapy

@AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk @JournoJess_ respiratory paediatrician at Royal Stoke confirming a rise in cases of children showing new respiratory symptoms connected to Walley’s Quarry gases! This is now the 2nd Dr to speak out!This is terrifying! #stopthestink https://t.co/WOc9ECqa58
@EnvAgency Seems to be a particularly bad night again... remind us why the point in the enforcement notice was....are you out and about tonight?  @EnvAgencyMids... what’s going on @RedIndustries2???

I've seen the stink from Walley's reported from inside Newcastle-under-Lyme @vuecinemas this evening as well as in other town centre locations.

This is exactly what was feared - why on earth weren't the additional requirements of the operator identified earlier? @EnvAgency

@DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Medium term is 15-90 days and so should already have been applied from 11th March. We are now beyond 90 days of AQM and so presumably long term exposure durations, especially if you take into account increased complaints which began in December and so six months ago!

Question - @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA
Why is the wrong health limit applied to Whalleys Quarry Landfill given that our community's health has been affected for many years. My son already has brain scaring & CP. The constant exposure to H2S is causing him headache & nose bleeds! https://t.co/Mo50j35VW5

40 minute wait for the @EnvAgency tonight , no doubt many callers will get fed up - is that a tactic @ClareDinnisEA ? Keep the numbers low & start to float under the radar again, just over 2 months til you want to remove the monitors - a LOT of work to do by then! #stopthestink

@Tus_M_ @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk @JournoJess_ @MrNickKnowles please listen to this,we are terified,we’ve done everything, we’ve begged, shouted,been on every news channel and in so many newspapers:radio interviews. tweets.text: @MissyDoom @SianieRoo @DrMickSalt @RedIndustries2 The thing that @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @pow_rebecca @RedIndustries2  don’t get is that we do fully understand. tweets.text: @AaronBell4NUL @vuecinemas @EnvAgency Aaron, remember when you said “we want the streets heaving, not the people heaving.”  It’s too late. It’s here and it’s happening. Newcastle WILL be dead on arrival after the pandemic. What a total embarrassment this is @NewsNBC @SimonTagg ☠️ #stopthestink https://t.co/XT6XYqAhY6
@DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Is there a long term exposure level of more than 90 days. I would say we are at that point or very close to.

#StopTheStink: @PHE_uk and @EnvAgencyMids, since this is now a medium-term issue (90-days), why is the more stringent WHO tolerability of 20 μg m¯³ hydrogen sulphide not applied when considering respiratory effects? (Ref: Page 5 of https://t.co/0IJ1VGs9pk) https://t.co/tkqsRQ1FxM

When your house stinks of landfill gas & you have to fight to stop yourself vomiting 🤮 
Constant sore throat. asthma symptoms & anxiety over my son are draining #stopthestink @StinkStopthe @MattHancock @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency @PHE_WestMids  @PHE_EoEngland https://t.co/OBe73KIN7C

Our officers are attending a large fire that broke out at a recycling centre in Tyseley, Birmingham this morning.
 
We're monitoring the local watercourse for any impact from the fire run-off water on the #environment 

#WestMidlands https://t.co/wdnfFIUpHo

We worked with St Neots angling society, @huntsdc & @stneotscouncil on a backwater enhancement project on the river Great Ouse🐟

The work involved removing silt, clearing vegetation, removing fallen tree branches and more. Before & after pics👇Read more: https://t.co/zXMQCbQUl9 https://t.co/doT0HeKqWJ

urls.title: £39,000 invested in fisheries in Cambridgeshire and Bedfordshire
urls.description: The Environment Agency has invested over £1.3 million in projects in the last year to enhance fisheries, boost fish stocks and make improvements for anglers.
